column1: Script that creates Active Directory users from CSV file

column2:
# Do standard DNS zone configuration before
# Do not forget that the DNS Server itself will use its loopback as source address
# Do not forget that the DNS Server itself will prefer its IPv6 loopback address over its IPv4 address

Add-DnsServerZoneScope -ZoneName [name] -Name [scope name]
Add-DnsServerResourceRecord -ZoneName [name] -A -Name [host name] -IPv4Address [IP] -ZoneScope [scope]
Add-DnsServerClientSubnet -Name [subnet name] -IPv4Subnet [CIDR]
Add-DnsServerQueryResolutionPolicy -Name [policy name] -Action ALLOW -ClientSubnet "{EQ/NE},[subnet name 1],[subnet name  ...]" -ZoneScope "[scope name]" -ZoneName [name] -ProcessingOrder [Order]

column1: Name of the program with which the hostname and domain can be configured
Name of the program with which network interfaces can be configured
Allow remote management from device outside of the domain configuration
column2:
winrm qc
Enable-PSRemoting -force
Set-Item WSMan:localhost\client\trustedhosts -value {[IP]/[hostname]/[domain]/*]} -Concatenate
New-NetFirewallRule -DisplayName [name] -Direction Inbound -Action Allow -Protocol TCP -LocalPort 5985

column1: Allow remote management to device outside of the domain configuration
Update PowerShell help information from offline path
Different ways to get help for a powershell command
NTP client configuration for PDC Master
column2:
net stop w32tm
w32tm /config /SyncFromFlags:manual /ManualPeerList:"[IP],0x8" /reliable:yes /update
w32tm /config /update
net start w32tm
